skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: The impetuousness of the oldest Phoenix of the Flamespyre has faded to naught, but its wisdom, strength and loyalty to Caradryan remain true.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

skillTree.localised_description: Quick and lithe are the Asur, for the Creator gifts them his own unnatural speed, while reserving the greatest of such boons for His champion.
Caradryan walks the world as if he has been doused in the flames of Asuryan Himself, affording him protection from harm.
With no prattling tongue to distract Caradryan from matters of great import, no event is so small as to evade his stoic gaze.
The more Caradryan immerses himself in the fiery letters of the past, present and future, the more his supernatural vitality grows.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: Being closest to the thoughts of the Creator God marks Caradryan with the divine strength to lead Asuryan's guardians.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10% for Melee infantry units
	(own army)

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Years of silent study and contemplation without utterance has honed Caradryan’s mind to accomplish tasks with immaculate focus.

effects.description: Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 3
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: Bound by a magical vow of silence, Caradryan and his guard fight with the unshakeable resolve of those who know their god's plan.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for Phoenix Guard units
	(all armies factionwide)

Ward save: 10% for Phoenix Guard units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Just as energy is transferred and never lost, so too are certain aspects of the radiance that emanates from Asuryan’s chosen.

effects.description:
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Fire spells
	(Hero's army)

Winds of Magic cost: -20% for Lore of Fire spells
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the fires of creation burn bright in one’s soul, life can be given anew.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Phoenix units
	(Hero's army)

Phoenix Rebirth: 30% chance for destroyed Phoenix Guard and Phoenix units to be restored after battle
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The rune of the Creator upon Caradryan's brow glows brightest in times of danger, scorching any foe who comes near.

effects.description:
Enables magical attacks for Phoenix Guard units
	(Hero's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 20%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 1
Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 2
Cleanse Corruption action: Corruption is reduced by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

items.colour_text: This ancient, flame-wreathed armament was enchanted for the first Captain of the Phoenix Guard as a fiery symbol of divine station.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Despite his vow of silence, Caradryan’s inspiring presence is felt throughout the land as though Asuryan Himself has taken up arms.

effects.description: Construction cost: -20% for Worship buildings(factionwide when on map)

Upkeep: -25% for Phoenix Guard units
	(own army)
